item.title: Nobel Prize in physics showcases what works in American science
item.description: Letters from readers about recent health and science news.

item.title: How India tariffs hurt America’s China strategy
item.description: New Delhi can be a counterweight to Beijing’s economic and military bellicosity.

item.title: The RSS is a warning to all nations where populism is spiking
item.description: Groups like India’s RSS wouldn’t amass millions of members without appealing to a perceived need.

item.title: A shadow looms over Nevada’s solar boom — and the whole country
item.description: The cancellation of a massive solar project is a sad commentary on America’s energy development.

item.title: What Putin is crushing in Russia
item.description: The arrest of opposition leader Maxim Kruglov is a blow against the last vestiges of Russian democracy.

item.title: The new Dr. Google is in. Here’s how to use it.
item.description: Chatbots can help patients with their health, when used with caution.

item.title: Two weddings and a funeral show what H-1B chaos costs America
item.description: Trump’s H-1B visa fee might never go into effect, but much of the damage is already done.

item.title: I’m a veteran on disability. This reporting hurt me.
item.description: Readers respond to a recent Post series about fraud in the VA disability benefits system.

item.title: Primary credit for the Gaza ceasefire goes to the IDF — and Netanyahu
item.description: The diplomats’ hour arrived after, and because of, Israel’s response to unprovoked, wanton violence.

item.title: Crossroads
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on ceasefire in Israel-Gaza war.

item.title: The Nobel Prize finally recognizes what matters most in economics
item.description: Free-market economies have challenges, but they are very good at one thing: innovation.

item.title: The most shortsighted way to end the government shutdown
item.description: Getting rid of the filibuster would spell disaster for Republicans.

item.title: Why the Gaza ceasefire won’t lead to lasting peace
item.description: “A new Middle East” will require sacrifices that Israelis and Palestinians show no sign of making.

item.title: The day after war has arrived
item.description: Forging a lasting peace between Israelis and Palestinians requires American leadership.

item.title: Choosing the next Dalai Lama is surprisingly dangerous
item.description: Renewed political instability in Tibet could well spiral into the next U.S.-China flash point.

item.title: This is no way for political campaigns to treat their own workers
item.description: Debts run up by Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton made news. But smaller campaigns stiff workers, too.

item.title: As a professor, I’ve seen woke and MAGA censorship. Which is worse?
item.description: Both attacks on free speech are devastating for academia, but in different ways.

item.title: Two Supreme Court cases, one unasked question about trans kids
item.description: Conversion therapy case shows how lawyers and judges complicate the gender debate.

item.title: Struggling with Gen Z slang? Embrace the delulu.
item.description: Today’s teen slang is more absurd, global-reaching and irony-laden, thanks to TikTok.
